title: Maccabi Umm al-Fahm F.C.
text:
Maccabi Umm al-Fahm F.C. () are a <a href="association%20football">football</a> club, from the north Israeli city of <a href="Umm%20al-Fahm">Umm al-Fahm</a>. The club currently plays in <a href="Liga%20Bet">Liga Bet</a> North B division, the fourth tier of <a href="Football%20in%20Israel">Israeli football</a>. Home matches are played at the <a href="HaShalom%20Stadium">HaShalom Stadium</a>.
History.
The club was founded in 1972, and played in the lower divisions of Israeli football. In the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Liga%20Alef">2010–11 season</a> the club won <a href="Liga%20Alef">Liga Alef</a> North division, and was promoted to <a href="Liga%20Leumit">Liga Leumit</a>, the second tier of Israeli football, where they played three seasons.
In the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Liga%20Leumit">2013–14 season</a>, the club was relegated to Liga Alef after finished bottom of Liga Leumit, and set negative record of being the first club in the history of professional football in Israel, which have finished a season with a negative number of points (−4, after 5 points deducted), and without any win, drawing one game, and losing all the other 36 games.
The <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Liga%20Alef">2014–15 season</a> was similarly poor, as the club dropped further to <a href="Liga%20Bet">Liga Bet</a>, after finished the season with 0 points, following a deduction of 1 point for fielding ineligible player, and completed a second successive season without win, drawing one game, and losing all the other 29 games.
